column4: I need to downgrade samba-common Ubuntu3.8 to samba-common Ubuntu3 in order to install Samba (Ubuntu 10.04), according to Synaptic it requires the removal of ubuntu-desktop, is that safe?
would it actually remove the desktop and leave me with a command-line?, or is the package name 'ubuntu-desktop' just mis-leading?
a package that just contains information relating to other packages. It contains no code as such
